snippet: Is the rise in reported cases of A.D.H.D. in school-age children accurate, and are the potent drugs to treat it being overused?
abstract: Editorials questions whether rise in reported cases of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder in school-age children is accurate, and if potent drugs to treat it are being overused; maintains with growing concern that many young people may be sharing or abusing these drugs, it is crucial that parents and doctors are vigilant about overmedication.
lead_paragraph: Is the rise in reported cases of A.D.H.D. in school-age children accurate, and are the potent drugs to treat it being overused?

headline.seo: Worry Over Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder
